mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, George Washington to William Pearce, 1796 April 3
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Washington, George, 1732-1799
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Washington writes about the vessel Commerce coming from Liverpool and arriving in Georgetown with eight bushels of field pea, chiccory and eight bushels of winter vetch--directions for the cultivation--wind blowing down trees--selling the flour--Mr. Minor has recommended a Mr. Darnes as a tenant--Mr. Gill and renting the mill--inquires of the dimensions and details on the chimney in the new room at the Mansion. Autograph letter signed, 4 pages.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Farm management
